com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing.checkpoint

Class CheckpointAbstract<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

    public abstract class CheckpointAbstract<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
extends EntityImpl
implements Checkpoint<E,P>
    Abstract class for checkpoints.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

      • getMemoryZone

        public MemoryZone getMemoryZone()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns the MemoryZone which is used by the checkpoint (i.e. the MemoryZone where the checkpoint is saved).

      • setMemoryZone

        public void setMemoryZone(MemoryZone zone)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Updates the MemoryZone of the checkpoint.

        The Checkpoint.delete() method is first called before the new zone is set. This means that after changing the MemoryZone, any saved state in the checkpoint will be lost.
        Use Checkpoint.copy(MemoryZone) to copy the checkpoint to another MemoryZone without losing the saved state.

        Specified by:
        setMemoryZone in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

      • getCheckpointTime

        public long getCheckpointTime()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns the simulation time corresponding to the moment when the state of the parent runnable entity was last checkpointed.
        Specified by:
        getCheckpointTime in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Returns:
        the simulation time when this checkpoint was updated or a negative value if the checkpoint has never been updated

      • isCheckpointStateSet

        public boolean isCheckpointStateSet(byte state)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Tests if the given state is set and returns true if it is and false if it is not.

        See Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_UPDATING, Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_RECOVERING and Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_COPYING for possible values for the state parameter.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_STATE_CHANGED notification is thrown when the state of the checkpoint changes.

        Specified by:
        isCheckpointStateSet in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the given state is set, and false otherwise.

      • isCheckpointBusy

        public boolean isCheckpointBusy()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns true if the checkpoint is being used.

        If you need to check single state, then use Checkpoint.isCheckpointStateSet(byte) instead.

        Specified by:
        isCheckpointBusy in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint is being used

      • canUpdate

        public boolean canUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be updated.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The parent RunnableEntity has terminated (e.g. failed);
        • The checkpoint has no set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • There is an active process using the checkpoint: either an update, a recovery or a copy (see Checkpoint.isCheckpointBusy());
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the update.
        Specified by:
        canUpdate in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be updated

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        This method updates the checkpoint. After the update the checkpoint will reflect the state of its parent RunnableEntity at the current simulation time.

        The parent RunnableEntity may be paused at any moment of the update, and it is resumed once the update is finished.

        During the update, the state Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_UPDATING is set. Once the update is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the checkpoint was updated and acknowledged successfully or not.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

      • cancelUpdate

        public void cancelUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Cancels an ongoing update.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the update is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Specified by:
        cancelUpdate in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

      • canRecover

        public boolean canRecover(P parent,
                 E toReplace)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be used for recovery with the given parameters.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The checkpoint has no set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • The checkpoint was never updated and there is no saved state to use for recovery;
        • There is an active update process which is modifying the checkpoint (see Checkpoint.isCheckpointStateSet(byte));
        • The given parent entity cannot be used (it has no parents, it / or one of its parents has failed, it / or one of its parents is powered off);
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the recovery.
        Specified by:
        canRecover in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Parameters:
        parent - the entity which will be used as a parent for the newly created RunnableEntity during the recovery process (might be null, in which case no tests relative to this param is done)
        toReplace - the RunnableEntity to replace if the recovery process is successful (might be null, in which case no tests relative to this param is done)
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be used for recovery using the given parameters

      • recover

        public void recover(P parent,
           E toReplace)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Uses the checkpoint data to create a new RunnableEntity that has the same state as the parent RunnableEntity when the checkpoint was last updated.

        The newly created RunnableEntity is defined as a child of the given parent entity. And all necessary resources are allocated for the newly created RunnableEntity on the parent entity.

        If the toReplace entity is given and is not null, then we first remove that entity before trying to allocate new resources for the newly created RunnableEntity. Note, however, that if the recovery process fails, then the toReplace entity is not removed.

        During the recovery, the state Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_RECOVERING is set. Once the recovery is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the recovery process was successful or not.

        Specified by:
        recover in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Parameters:
        parent - the entity which is used as a parent for the newly created RunnableEntity during the recovery process
        toReplace - the RunnableEntity to replace if the recovery process is successful (might be null)

      • cancelRecover

        public void cancelRecover()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Cancels an ongoing recovery.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the recover is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Specified by:
        cancelRecover in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

      • canCopy

        public boolean canCopy(MemoryZone zone)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be copied to the given zone.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The checkpoint has not a set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • The checkpoint was never updated and there is no saved state to copy;
        • There is an active update process which is modifying the checkpoint (see Checkpoint.isCheckpointStateSet(byte));
        • The given zone is the same as the Checkpoint's MemoryZone (see Checkpoint.getMemoryZone());
        • The given zone is not usable;
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the copy.
        Specified by:
        canCopy in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Parameters:
        zone - the MemoryZone where to copy the checkpoint
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be copied to the given zone

      • canCopy

        public boolean canCopy()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Same as Checkpoint.canCopy(MemoryZone), but does not make any tests relative to the MemoryZone where the checkpoint will be copied.
        Specified by:
        canCopy in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Returns:
        true if the copy is possible using this checkpoint given a valid MemoryZone.

      • copy

        public void copy(MemoryZone zone)
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Create a copy of the checkpoint using another MemoryZone.

        This method returns immediately, you need to listen to appropriate notification codes to know when the checkpoint have been copied.

        During the copy, the state Checkpoint.CHECKPOINT_STATE_COPYING is set. Once the copy is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_COPY_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_COPY_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the copy process was successful or not.

        Specified by:
        copy in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Parameters:
        zone - the MemoryZone where to copy the checkpoint

      • cancelCopy

        public void cancelCopy()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Cancels an ongoing copy.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the copy is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Specified by:
        cancelCopy in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

      • canDelete

        public boolean canDelete()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be deleted.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • There is an active process which is using the checkpoint (see Checkpoint.isCheckpointBusy());
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the deletion.
        Specified by:
        canDelete in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be deleted

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Description copied from interface: Checkpoint
        Deletes the checkpoint.

        This method will reduce the size of the MemoryZone used by the checkpoint to zero.
        The parent and the MemoryZone of the checkpoint are not modified.

        After deleting the checkpoint, it will no longer be usable by the Checkpoint.update(), Checkpoint.recover(Entity, RunnableEntity) or Checkpoint.copy(MemoryZone) methods.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
